stages.logText: I've agreed to help the Feygard patrol captain investigate why there is so much beer on the Foaming flask tavern property.

After bribing Torilo, the owner of the Foaming flask, he stated that he and other tavern owners had a 'business agreement' with a group of 'distributors'. He suggested that I ask other tavern owners for more information.
After bribing Tharwyn, the owner of the Vilegard tavern, he stated as part of his 'business agreement', Dunla, the local thief, is one of his 'distributors'. He suggested that I talk to him.
Dunla, the thief in Vilegard instructed me to speak with Farrick if I want to learn more about the tavern owner's 'business agreement' with their 'distributors'.
Farrik told me that the beer is coming from Sullengard. I really should go there next.
To earn his trust, Mayor Ale has asked that I deliver his letter to Kealwea, the Sullengard priest.
I have done what Mayor Ale has asked of me as I have delivered his letter. I should now return to him.
Mayor Ale has explained everything to me about the 'business agreement' with the Thieves guild. I should head back to the Foaming flask tavern and speak with the captain.
I informed the guard captain at the loaming flask tavern all about the beer bootlegging operation.
I informed the guard captain at the Foaming flask tavern that the beer was being distributed by the Thieves guild.
I informed the guard captain at the Foaming flask tavern that Sullengard was responsible for brewing the beer.
I lied to the guard captain at the Foaming flask tavern and told him nothing about the beer bootlegging operation.
